By The Numbers   Social Media   News & Events   NYU Stern Street Team     Academics Business Degree   Business & Political Economy Degree   Faculty   Academic Advising   Research   Practitioners Seminar   Stern Bulletin     Stern Around the World International Studies Program   Business & Political Economy Degree Program   Short-Term Immersions   Semester Away     Social Impact Social Impact Curriculum   Social Impact Initiatives     Dynamic Community Building Community   Living & Learning in New York City   Leadership Initiatives   Student Clubs and Organizations     Future Success Professional Development   Internships & Careers     Admissions Financial Aid   Transfer Applicants   Apply               Home / Programs & Admissions / Undergraduate / Dynamic Community / Student Clubs and Organizations                        Share / Print                Print      Email      Share       Like                                              Student Clubs and Organizations  A great leader has not only an outstanding educational background, but also communication skills, a global perspective, and a sense of professional responsibility.   Professional Clubs  The Undergraduate College has an active club system comprised of member clubs overseen by the Inter-Club Council (ICC). The clubs promote professional development in a broad range of industries and interests, from finance and accounting to social impact and entertainment. Many of the clubs focus on career development and cultivate strong relationships with companies and organizations as well as Stern alumni who continue to support the club system by attending or speaking at events.     Student Council  Student Council acts as the official student governing body of the Undergraduate College, whose purpose is to foster the NYU and Stern community, provide an open forum for all of its constituents, and promote leadership. Student Council provides a wide array of social programming meant to promote the Stern community and engage all students. Past event include Casino Night, Class Wars, Fall Harvest, Stern Talent Show, and Semi-Formal.     All University Clubs  Students have an opportunity to become engaged with the 400+ NYU All University Clubs which are open to all NYU students. Impact & Innovation   Urbanization Project                                       Kip Walk, Coporate Director, Sustainability, Blommer            Jonathan Atwood, V.P. Sustainable Living and Corporate Communications, Unilever            Tensie Whelan, President, Rain Forrest Alliance, 2014-2015 Stern-Citi Leadership & Ethics Distinguished Fellow                Mission Statement    The Business and Society Program is an interdisciplinary endeavor that prepares and supports business leaders in creating value for shareholders, stakeholders, and society. Drawing upon the best scholarship and research in law, economics, psychology, and philosophy, the faculty and staff of BSP are dedicated to furthering education, research, and public engagement in fields such as professional responsibility, human rights, law and business, social entrepreneurship, and the design of ethically effective organizations.        –                                     Quick Links       Faculty    Undergraduate Courses    MBA Courses    Citi Program in Leadership & Ethics          Upcoming Seminars   Paduano Symposium in Business Ethics Spring 2015  Paduano Seminars will be from 3:00 – 4:20pm (Snacks served beginning at 2:55) and will be located at 44 W. 4th Street, Kaufman  Management Center, Room 5­140  Learn more about the Paduano Symposium in Business Ethics .      Contact Us    Business & Society Program  NYU Stern School of Business  44 West 4th Street, Henry Kaufman Management Center 7th Floor  New York, New York 10012     Bruce Buchanan  Director, Business & Society Program  C.W. Nichols Professor of Business Ethics  Professor of Marketing   bbuchana@stern.nyu.edu     Rachel Kowal  Deputy Director, Business & Society Program  Clinical Professor of Business Law   rkowal@stern.nyu.edu            Upcoming Events    Social Innovation Symposium February 20, 2015  For more information visit: http://www.nyusis.com/about     Rainforest Alliance Sustainable Cocoa Investment Challenge  Proposals are due on Feb. 16th, 2015. For more information visit:   http://www.rainforest-alliance.org/challenge     Citi Leadership & Ethics Conference, February 27th, 2015      This year's conference will feature Distinguished Citi Fellow in Leadership & Ethics Tensie Whelan (BA '80) , president of the Rainforest Alliance.  Click here to RSVP.  View the 2015 Citi Conference Agenda.     Aspen Institute's 2015 Business & Society International MBA Case Competition, March 2015  Click here for more information.
